1. Timestamp: Replay attacks often occur within a short time frame, so we can check the timestamp of the utterance to see if it falls within this time frame.
2. MAC address: MAC addresses are unique identifiers for devices, so we can check the MAC address of the device that generated the utterance to see if it matches the MAC address of the device that generated the original utterance.
3. Audio quality: Replay attacks often have lower audio quality than the original utterance, so we can check the audio quality of the utterance to see if it matches the quality of the original utterance.

Based on these factors, we can determine whether the utterance is a result of a replay attack or not.
